title: Kerning Help / Advice
content:
Just wondering if you’d share your thoughts on the kerning of this. I feel like that no matter what I do to the word “Karma” it looks ’off’. My wife says I should connect or bridge the r and m, but I’m not ready to do that yet.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [kern.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20090909163403/http:/typophile.com/files/kern.gif) | 3.73 KB |
author: wyndom

comments.content: You have space the whole around the pair. I’d try leaving the KA pair alone and loosening up the rest to appear more balanced. Did you make the small caps a little smaller?
thank you, I’ll give that a shot. The small caps were not modified at all.

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090909163403im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/kern_4496.gif)
  
This feels a little better, I would def. appreciate any additional comments/feedback

The DH could be a gnat’s tighter I think.

Tim

Speaking as the new kid, this is more a question than a critique - I’m looking at “Karma,” and noticing there’s a pretty distinct difference between AR/MA and RM. Would you say that’s good kerning? This is an area of weakness for me, and I seek to learn, sensei.

The aim of kerning is to create a similar area between characters, but not at the expense of making it difficult to read. It looks good to me.

Tim
Now see there? I learned something. I feel better about myself. Thanks, Tim!

I don’t have as much a problem with the kerning as the weight differences of the B and K with the other characters. They feel heavier and might be creating a color shift you don’t like. Over all everything is looser than I would like, buts thats me.
